newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks close mostly lower, hotels down.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks close mostly lower, hotels down.

text.p: Croatian stocks closed mostly lower on Wednesday, with new losses among hoteliers.
* Of ten active issues eight were down, two up.
* The turnover was up at 11.4 million kuna, volume also higher at 7,075 shares. (Exchange rate: 5.4566 kuna = $1)
* The biggest gainer was drug firm Pliva, which rose 289 kuna to close at 13,300, with 538 shares traded.
* The biggest loser was Istrian hotelier Riviera, which fell 30 kuna to close at 220 kuna on a small volume of 70 shares.
* The most active issue was Zagrebacka banka, which edged down 15 kuna to close at 1,035 on volume of 2,709 shares.
